publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4888# Mr Jamie Stone: The Caithness Economy Post-Dounreay—That the Parliament notes the severe economic and social challenges for the far north presented by the accelerated run-down and decommissioning at Dounreay and considers that the Scottish Executive should work with the UK Government and other key players to ensure that a costed and funded strategy is put in place as soon as possible so that suitable replacement industries and jobs can be established for the years to come.

S2M-4888# Mr Jamie Stone: The Caithness Economy Post-Dounreay—That the Parliament notes the severe economic and social challenges for the far north presented by the accelerated run-down and decommissioning at Dounreay and considers that the Scottish Executive should work with the UK Government and other key players to ensure that a costed and funded strategy is put in place as soon as possible so that suitable replacement industries and jobs can be established for the years to come. Supported by: John Swinburne*, Dave Petrie*, Mike Rumbles*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Margaret Smith*, Mr Jim Wallace*
S2M-4888# The Caithness Economy Post-Dounreay (lodged on 28 September 2006) Mr Andrew Arbuckle*
S2M-4888# The Caithness Economy Post-Dounreay (lodged on 28 September 2006) Nora Radcliffe*, Maureen Macmillan*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4888# The Caithness Economy Post-Dounreay (lodged on 28 September 2006) Shiona Baird*
S2M-4888# The Caithness Economy Post-Dounreay (lodged on 28 September 2006) Murray Tosh*

S2M-4888# Mr Jamie Stone: The Caithness Economy Post-Dounreay—That the Parliament notes the severe economic and social challenges for the far north presented by the accelerated run-down and decommissioning at Dounreay and considers that the Scottish Executive should work with the UK Government and other key players to ensure that a costed and funded strategy is put in place as soon as possible so that suitable replacement industries and jobs can be established for the years to come. Supported by: John Swinburne, Dave Petrie, Mike Rumbles, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Margaret Smith, Mr Jim Wallace, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Nora Radcliffe, Maureen Macmillan, Donald Gorrie, Shiona Baird, Murray Tosh
S2M-4888# The Caithness Economy Post-Dounreay (lodged on 28 September 2006) Robin Harper*
